page.title: 05LLANSAMLET PAST & PRESENT(2)
page.content:
Old Welsh flannel was sold in the parish hall.Cheap china was sold at 6 pence a time.Mr Smith used to be the barber, from 1925-1975.He used to charge 6 pence for men and 3 pence for little boys.Llansamlet has changed a great deal.Everyone was like one big family, the same attitudes, the same way of life.But now, the younger generation have stepped in and the family has gone it's seperate ways.Mr Smith is a community warden.He has to open and lock things like: the church, the community centre and the Parish hall.The community centre is used for a lot of things from flower arranging to discos.
Karen Rees
